summary: Robert C. Morrison was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list Morrison's name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. He appears in payroll certifications from April 1978 through January 1979, indicating his employment spanned at least this period. The documents do not specify his exact role within the SCAS, but his presence on the payroll suggests he was a staff member involved in the committee's operations.
significance: Robert C. Morrison's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, which was tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's activities.
